medium: Brush and red chalk wash, over black chalk, on beige laid paper
creditline: Bequest of Dan Fellows Platt, Class of 1895
inscribed:
Inscribed recto, lower left, in dark brown ink:
Tiepolo fece

makers.displaydate: 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain
makers.displaymaker: Giovanni Battista Tiepolo, 1696–1770; born Venice, Italy; died Madrid, Spain

texts.textentryhtml:
Count Bernardino Algarotti-Corniani, Venice ?; Edward Cheney, Badger Hall, Shropshire ?; E. Parsons & Sons, London, 1923; Dan Fellows Platt, stamps (L. 750a and 2066b) verso, lower left, in blue.'
Purchased by Platt from Parsons 1923.;


From Pignatti, “I disegni veneziani…”: Dateable c. 1725. (See reference Bib. 4577);


From Baxandall, “Shadows and enlightenment”: reproduces copy of Princeton original, dates it “”firmly in the 1720s.” (See reference Bib. 4581);
